go_data.justification: AKR7A2 is an NADPH-dependent aldo-keto reductase that catalyzes the reduction of succinic semialdehyde (SSA) to gamma-hydroxybutyrate (GHB).
AKR7A2 catalyzes the reduction of succinic semialdehyde (SSA) to gamma-hydroxybutyrate (GHB), an important reaction in the degradation pathway for the inhibitory neurotransmitter GABA.
As an enzyme involved in the degradation pathway of GABA, AKR7A2 is likely located in the cytoplasm.
